meanings.definition: Direct or guide along a particular course
meanings.sent1: She channeled her energy into studying for the test.
meanings.sent2: The river channeled its way through the valley.
meanings.sent3: He channeled all his excitement into planning the surprise party.
meanings.sent4: Her determination channeled her towards success.
meanings.sent5: The coach channeled the team's focus on winning the championship.

meanings.definition: Transmit or convey through or as if through a channel
meanings.sent1: The radio channeled the news to listeners around the world.
meanings.sent2: The internet channeled information to users seamlessly.
meanings.sent3: The magician channeled his thoughts to the audience through his performance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile channeled warmth to everyone she met.
meanings.sent5: The conductor channeled emotions through the music, touching the hearts of the audience.

meanings.definition: Divert or focus towards a particular end or purpose
meanings.sent1: She channeled her frustration into a productive art project.
meanings.sent2: The speaker channeled the crowd's attention to the main topic.
meanings.sent3: The comedian channeled the awkward situation into a hilarious joke.
meanings.sent4: His passion channeled his career towards success.
meanings.sent5: The mentor channeled the student's potential towards achieving their goals.
